de.lmu.ifi.dbs.elki.math.spacefillingcurves

Class HilbertSpatialSorter

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.lmu.ifi.dbs.elki.math.spacefillingcurves.AbstractSpatialSorter
      • de.lmu.ifi.dbs.elki.math.spacefillingcurves.HilbertSpatialSorter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    SpatialSorter

    @Reference(authors="D. Hilbert",
           title="\u00dcber die stetige Abbildung einer Linie auf ein Fl\u00e4chenst\u00fcck",
           booktitle="Mathematische Annalen, 38(3)")
public class HilbertSpatialSorter
extends AbstractSpatialSorter
    Sort object along the Hilbert Space Filling curve by mapping them to their Hilbert numbers and sorting them. Objects are mapped using 31 bits per dimension. Reference:

    D. Hilbert
    Über die stetige Abbildung einer Linie auf ein Flächenstück
    In: Mathematische Annalen, 38(3)

    Author:
    Erich Schubert

    • Nested Class Summary

      private static class  HilbertSpatialSorter.HilbertRef<T extends SpatialComparable>
      Object used in spatial sorting, combining the spatial object and the object ID.

    • Method Detail

      • sort

        public <T extends SpatialComparable> void sort(List<T> objs,
                                               int start,
                                               int end,
                                               double[] minmax,
                                               int[] dims)
        Description copied from interface: SpatialSorter
        Sort part of the list (start to end).
        Type Parameters:
        T - actual type we sort
        Parameters:
        objs - the spatial objects to be sorted
        start - First index to sort (e.g. 0)
        end - End of range (e.g. site())
        minmax - Array with dim pairs of (min, max) of value ranges
        dims - Dimensions to sort by, for indexing vectors and minmax.

      • coordinatesToHilbert

        public static long[] coordinatesToHilbert(long[] coords,
                                          int bitsperdim,
                                          int offset)
        Interleave one long per dimension (using the "bitsperdim" highest bits) to a hilbert address.
        Parameters:
        coords - Original coordinates
        bitsperdim - Number of bits to use.
        offset - offset
        Returns:
        Hilbert address
